meanings.definition: The act of resigning or giving up a position or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: Her demission from the company surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: After much consideration, he submitted his demission to the board.
meanings.sent3: The demission of the class clown left the students with mixed feelings.
meanings.sent4: His demission was like a weight lifted off his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The demission speech was heartfelt and emotional.

meanings.definition: The act of dismissing or discharging someone from a position.
meanings.sent1: The demission of the employee was necessary due to repeated misconduct.
meanings.sent2: The demission of the coach shocked the team.
meanings.sent3: The demission of the noisy neighbor was celebrated by all.
meanings.sent4: Her demission felt like a sudden loss in the office.
meanings.sent5: The demission process was handled professionally and respectfully.

meanings.definition: The act of relinquishing or surrendering something.
meanings.sent1: The demission of his claim to the throne surprised many.
meanings.sent2: She made the difficult demission of her dreams for the sake of her family.
meanings.sent3: The demission of the last piece of cake caused a small uproar.
meanings.sent4: His demission of power was a strategic move in the political game.
meanings.sent5: The demission of control led to a sense of freedom and relief.
